index Class

Defined in: lib/api/index.js:4
Module: index
Parent Module: arango

The api module to create indices for collections in ArangoDB.

  • Index
  • Methods

(
  • [collection]
  • fields
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/index.js:194

Creates a bitarray index for the collection collection-name, if it does not already exist.

Parameters:

  • [collection] String optional
    • The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined in the connection is used.
  • fields List
    • A list of attribute paths.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

createCapIndex

(
  • [collection]
  • data
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/index.js:16

Creates a Cap Index for the collection

Parameters:

  • [collection] String optional
    • The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined in the connection is used.
  • data Object
    • a JSON Object containing at least one attributes:
    • [size] Number optional
      • The maximal number of documents for the collection.
    • [byteSize] Number optional
      • The maximal size of the active document data in the collection.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

createFulltextIndex

(
  • [collection]
  • fields
  • [minLength]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/index.js:157

Creates a fulltext index for the collection collection-name, if it does not already exist.

Parameters:

  • [collection] String optional
    • The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined in the connection is used.
  • fields List
    • A list of attribute paths.
  • [minLength] Number optional
    • Minimum character length of words to index. Will default to a server-defined value if unspecified. It is thus recommended to set this value explicitly when creating the index.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

createGeoSpatialIndex

(
  • [collection]
  • fields
  • [options]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/index.js:41

Creates a geo-spatial Index for the collection

Parameters:

  • [collection] String optional
    • The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined in the connection is used.
  • fields List
    • A list with one or two attribute paths. If it is a list with one attribute path location, then a geo-spatial index on all documents is created using location as path to the coordinates. The value of the attribute must be a list with at least two double values. The list must contain the latitude (first value) and the longitude (second value). All documents, which do not have the attribute path or with value that are not suitable, are ignored. If it is a list with two attribute paths latitude and longitude, then a geo-spatial index on all documents is created using latitude and longitude as paths the latitude and the longitude. The value of the attribute latitude and of the attribute longitude must a double. All documents, which do not have the attribute paths or which values are not suitable, are ignored.
  • [options] Object optional
    • a JSONObject with optional parameters:
    • [geoJson] Boolean optional

      If a geo-spatial index on a location is constructed and geoJson is true, then the order within the list is longitude followed by latitude. This corresponds to the format described in http://geojson.org/geojson-spec.html#positions

    • [constraint=false] Object optional
      • If constraint is true, then a geo-spatial constraint is created. The constraint is a non-unique variant of the index. Note that it is also possible to set the unique attribute instead of the constraint attribute.
    • [ignoreNull=false] Object optional
      • If a geo-spatial constraint is created and ignoreNull is true, then documents with a null in location or at least one null in latitude or longitude are ignored.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

createHashIndex

(
  • [collection]
  • fields
  • [unique=false]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/index.js:89

Creates a hash index for the collection collection-name, if it does not already exist.

Parameters:

  • [collection] String optional
    • The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined in the connection is used.
  • fields List
    • A list of attribute paths.
  • [unique=false] Boolean optional
    • If true, then create a unique index.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:
